article.Heading: India needs to aspire to economic growth rates of 8-9%: Jaitley
article.Summary: "The Indian normal has to be in the 8 or 9 percent category," Jaitley said in an interview at the Economic Times Global Business Summit. "It is only at that pace that you can get rid of poverty."
article.Body:
India needs to aspire to economic growth rates of 8-9 percent if it is to lift its legion poor out of poverty, Finance Minister Arun Jaitley said on Saturday.

"The Indian normal has to be in the 8 or 9 percent category," Jaitley said in an interview at the Economic Times Global Business Summit. "It is only at that pace that you can get rid of poverty."

Jaitley declined to be drawn on whether he would revise his fiscal deficit targets in his annual Budget next month.
